bigDescription: The closest planet to the sun, Mercury is the smallest planet in the entire solar system with a circumference of 4,880km. Despite being the closest planet to the sun, Mercury is not the hottest planet, second only to Venus. It still manages a temperature high of 430 Degrees. Mercury is also known for the large number of craters on its surface, mainly due to lots of asteroid impacts into the planet.
bp1: Both poles are constantly in shadow!
bp2: Named after the Roman God of Commerce!
bp3: A single day on Mercury takes 1408 hours!
